Module fi.tuni.monitor
Package fi.tuni.monitor.controllers

Class CoordinateSelectionController

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.monitor.controllers.CoordinateSelectionController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CoordinateSelectionController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for coordinate selection window.
A part of the MVC pattern, handles interaction with the view

    • coordinateFieldKeyTyped

      private void coordinateFieldKeyTyped(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Event handler for key types into coordinate fields
      Handles the pseudo class state of the text fields, i.e. coloring the text fields red if the input is invalid
      Parameters:
      event - The key event

    • handleMapViewInitialized

      private void handleMapViewInitialized(javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<? extends Boolean> observableValue, Boolean oldValue, Boolean newValue)
      Event handler for the mapview being initialized
      Sets properties of the mapview which can only be set after the mapview has been initialized
      Parameters:
      observableValue - The observable boolean value of the mapview's initialized state
      oldValue - The old value
      newValue - The new value

    • handleMapPointerMoved

      Event handler for the mouse pointer being moved over the mapview
      Updates the coordinate labels to the coordinates of the mouse pointer
      Parameters:

    • handleMapExtent

      private void handleMapExtent(com.sothawo.mapjfx.event.MapViewEvent event)
      Event handler for an extent being drawn on the mapview

      Parameters:
      event - The mapview extent event

    • handleMapClicked

      private void handleMapClicked(com.sothawo.mapjfx.event.MapViewEvent event)
      Event handler for mouse clicks on the mapview

      Parameters:
      event - The mapview mouse click event

    • handleTextFieldPseudoClassState

      private void handleTextFieldPseudoClassState(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      Helper method for handling the pseudo class state checking of a text field
      Sets the text field's pseudo class state to invalid if the text field's text is not a valid coordinate
      I.e. the text field is colored red if the text is not a valid coordinate
      Parameters:
      textField - The text field to check
